greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of numbers of prime factors (counted with multiplicities) of numbers between n-th and (n+1)-st prime.
comment: Also, number of prime factors (with multiplicity) of the product P(n) of the composite numbers between n-th and (n+1)-th prime.
reference: Amarnath Murthy, Generalization of Partition function, Introducing Smarandache Factor Partition. Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 11, 2000.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(6) = 8. Prime(6) = 13 and prime(7) = 17. 14, 15, and 16 are the composite numbers between 13 and 17.  14 has two prime factors (2 and 7); 15 has two prime factors (3 and 5); and 16 has four prime factors (2, 2, 2, and 2).  Thus, a(6) = 2 + 2 + 4 = 8 total prime factors.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Nov 03 2002
ext: More terms and better description from _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 29 2002
Corrected example [from Harvey P. Dale, May 25 2011]
